overall_perception_summary.headline: The Clinical Savior
overall_perception_summary.description: La Roche-Posay positions Cicaplast as a medical-grade fire extinguisher for the skin. It feels less like a beauty product and more like a prescription you don't need a doctor for—sterile, serious, and focused entirely on urgent repair. By anchoring on 'chemotherapy-safe' and 'baby-safe' claims, it establishes itself as the ultimate safety net for vulnerable skin.

foundation.title: The Medical Authority
foundation.description: The brand derives absolute authority from the clinic, not the garden, functioning as a Healer for pathologies (cracked skin, diaper rash) rather than cosmetic flaws. It operates as a Medical Authority, using 'Healing Ointment' terminology and sterile aesthetics to justify a Masstige price point. The payoff is not 'glow'; it is the cessation of suffering.

identity.title: The Sterile Caregiver
identity.description: The brand maintains a Distant professional distance, acting as The Reliable Expert who treats you, not a friend who hugs you. Dominated by The Caregiver (60%) through a lens of clinical rigor, the visual code is pure Pharma-Code—white, blue, and grid-based. The tone is The Clinical Authority: dry, precise, and devoid of humor.

communication.title: Rational Education
communication.description: Messaging hooks the user with The Molecule (Vitamin B5, Dimethicone) and persuades through Rational efficacy claims. The USP is The Specialist, owning the 'Healing' niche for specific skin traumas. The focus is Science Education, using comparison charts and ingredient deep-dives to teach mechanism rather than inspire desire.

benefits.title: Biological Restoration
benefits.description: Functionally, it is The Fixer, aggressively repairing the skin barrier rather than just moisturizing. The emotional payoff is Relief/Safety—the removal of panic regarding irritation or reaction. Socially, it is The Safe Choice, signaling a Pragmatist's reliance on 'what the doctors use' over trends.

marker_1.slider_a_label: [SLIDER] ORIGIN OF AUTHORITY (The Source of Power)
marker_1.reasoning: Authority is sourced directly from the white coat—'Recommended by 100,000 dermatologists worldwide' and 'Tribioxin Innovation' outweigh the thermal water mentions, placing trust in clinical validation (Authority: 2/5 Derm-Validated). The mission is fixing broken skin, not enhancing healthy skin—'Healing Ointment', 'Relieve & protect cracked skin', and 'Chemotherapy' suitability signal a focus on pathology and crisis intervention (Mission: 1/5 Pathology Cure). Derm authority + pathology fix = The Healer.
marker_1.evidence: Recommended by 100,000 dermatologists... Healing Ointment... Relieve & protect cracked, chapped, chafed skin... Suitable for patients undergoing chemotherapy

marker_2.slider_b_position_name: ▼ Approachable (Easy to find, easy to buy)
marker_2.reasoning: The scope is laser-focused on specific skin traumas—diaper rash, cracked hands, chemotherapy dryness—rather than general lifestyle improvement (Scope: 1/5 Micro-Correction). However, the barrier is low; despite the 'medical' positioning, it sells for $18.99 on Amazon/Target, making high-end clinical repair available to the masses without a prescription (Access: 4/5 Approachable). Accessible clinical repair = The Democratizers.
marker_2.evidence: $18.99... Diaper rash... Chemotherapy and radiation... #2 in Body Creams

marker_3.reasoning: Performance is defined by what it *doesn't* do (irritate). Claims like 'Baby Safe,' 'Fragrance Free,' and 'Suitable for babies as young as 1 week' prove the brand prioritizes extreme tolerance over aggressive active delivery (Performance: 1/5 Hypoallergenic). Transparency is high on the evidence side, citing 'Dimethicone 1%' and specific ingredient breakdown charts (Transparency: 2/5 Evidence-First). Extreme safety focus + clinical evidence = Safety First.
marker_3.evidence: Suitable for babies as young as 1 week... Fragrance Free... Paraben Free... Dimethicone 1%... Allergy tested

marker_4.reasoning: The aesthetic is aggressively sterile—white tubes, blue text, gloved hands, grid layouts. It looks like it belongs in a hospital, not a spa (Aesthetic: 1/5 Clinical Sterile). Priced at ~$14/oz ($18.99/1.35oz), it commands a significant premium over standard drugstore lotions (Nivea/Vaseline) but remains accessible, sitting in the pharmacy-premium tier (Value: 3/5 Masstige). Sterile look + premium drugstore price = The Medical Authority.
marker_4.evidence: White tube packaging... Gloved hand indicating professional use... Blue and black text... $18.99

marker_5.reasoning: The brand is professional and removed. While words like 'Soothes' and 'Comforting' appear, they are used as clinical descriptors, not emotional gestures. The visuals are cold and precise (Thermostat: 2/5 Distant). It positions itself above the user as the knowledgeable authority—'Consult a medical professional,' 'Dermatologist Insight' (Power Dynamic: 4/5 Specialist). Cold professional + high authority = The Reliable Expert.
marker_5.evidence: Dermatologist Insight... Consult a medical professional... Tribioxin Innovation... 100,000 dermatologists

marker_6.reasoning: The primary drive is to protect and heal the vulnerable ('Baby safe', 'Chemo patients', 'Repair'), identifying clearly as The Caregiver (60%). This is supported by The Sage (30%) providing the data ('TribioMa', 'Madecassoside') to justify the care. The Ruler (10%) appears in the market dominance claims ('#1 brand'). Dominant Caregiver (Structure/Service) + Sage = The Stabilizers, offering certainty and safety in a chaotic world.
marker_6.evidence: Suitable for babies... Patients undergoing chemotherapy... Tribioxin Innovation... Recommended by 100,000 dermatologists

marker_7.reasoning: Warmth Score: 1.5 (Low). Energy Score: 1.0 (Low). There is zero humor; the tone borders on grave with warnings like 'In case of swallowing get medical help.' The dress code is strict professional ('Apply cream as needed'). Enthusiasm is non-existent; the text is purely instructional and functional. Low Warmth + Low Energy = The Clinical Authority.
marker_7.evidence: In case of swallowing, get medical help... Apply cream as needed... Soothing Therapeutic Multi Purpose Cream... Avoid the eye area

marker_8.reasoning: The visual temperature is icy cold—dominated by clinical white backgrounds and medical blue accents (Thermostat: 1/5 Sterile). The layout is rigid and informational, utilizing grids, comparison charts, and line icons to convey data rather than emotion (Entropy: 2/5 Structured). Clinical colors + rigid structure = Pharma-Code, signaling safety through sterility.
marker_8.evidence: White tube... Blue text... Gloved hand... Comparison chart... Line icons
marker_8.look_and_feel: Clinical, sterile, and professional; a visual language of medical reliability.
marker_8.primary_palette: Clinical white background with authoritative black text and trusted medical blue accents.

marker_9.reasoning: The messaging hooks are chemical: 'Dimethicone 1%,' 'Vitamin B5,' 'Madecassoside,' 'Tribioma.' It assumes the user is looking for ingredients, not magic (Hook: 1/5 Molecule). The logic is purely rational—'Dermatologist tested,' 'Allergy tested,' 'Fragrance-free.' There is no poetry here, only facts (Persuasion: 1/5 Raw Data). Molecule focus + data persuasion = The Chemist.
marker_9.evidence: Dimethicone 1%... Vitamin B5... Madecassoside... Tribioma... Dermatologist tested... Allergy tested

marker_10.reasoning: The protagonist is not a founder, but a collective of '100,000 dermatologists.' The hero is the expertise itself (Protagonist: 1/5 Nobel). While Thermal Water is mentioned, the defining setting for *this* product (Cicaplast) is the lab—emphasizing 'Tribioxin Innovation' and 'New Enhanced Formula' over the natural source (Setting: 2/5 Tech-Forward). Expert hero + lab setting = The Lab Breakthrough.
marker_10.evidence: Recommended by 100,000 dermatologists... Tribioxin Innovation... New Enhanced Formula... Dermatologist Insight

marker_11.slider_b_position_name: ▼ The Stat ('95% saw reduction in acne')
marker_11.reasoning: The primary validator is 'The Board'—specifically the 100,000 dermatologists cited. This authoritative endorsement overrides user reviews in the visual hierarchy (Validator: 1/5 The Board). The proof is statistical and list-based—'Dimethicone 1%,' '5% Panthenol,' 'Baby Safe.' It relies on the clinical checklist (Proof: 2/5 The Stat). Authority validation + clinical stats = Derm-Validation.
marker_11.evidence: Recommended by 100,000 dermatologists... Dimethicone 1%... 5% Panthenol... Baby Safe

marker_12.slider_a_label: [SLIDER] THE OWNERSHIP OBJECT (What You Claim to Own)
marker_12.slider_b_label: [SLIDER] THE TARGET SCOPE (How Wide Is The Net?)
marker_12.reasoning: They own the 'Cicaplast' and 'Tribioma' complex names, creating a proprietary mental link (Ownership: 3/5 Complex). But the real edge is the scope: this isn't just dry skin cream; it's for 'diaper rash,' 'chemotherapy,' 'radiation,' and 'cracked skin.' It targets specific medical conditions (Scope: 5/5 The Condition). Proprietary complex + medical niche = The Specialist.
marker_12.evidence: Cicaplast... Tribioma... Chemotherapy and radiation... Diaper rash... Cracked skin

marker_13.reasoning: The content is heavy on education: comparison charts (Old vs New), ingredient breakdown panels (Vitamin B5, Tribioma), and usage diagrams. It aims to teach the user *why* it works (Depth: 2/5 Explainer). The goal is establishing clinical trust (The Thesis) rather than just pushing a sale; the medical warnings and gloved hands signal seriousness (Intent: 1/5 The Thesis). Education + Trust = Science Education.
marker_13.evidence: Ingredient panels... Comparison chart... Usage diagrams... Dermatologist Insight... Gloved hand

marker_14.reasoning: This is The Fixer. It explicitly claims to 'heal,' 'repair,' and 'treat' damaged conditions like cracked skin and diaper rash (Action: 5/5 The Fixer). The outcome is Biological—restoring the barrier, balancing the microbiome ('Tribioma'), and protecting skin integrity, rather than aesthetic improvement (Outcome: 1/5 Biological). Fixer mechanism + biological goal = Restoration.
marker_14.evidence: Healing Ointment... Treat and prevent diaper rash... Restore moisture barrier... TribioMa... Cracked skin

marker_15.slider_a_position_name: ▼ Panic Mode (Urgent need to stop pain/itch)
marker_15.slider_b_position_name: ▼ Sanctuary (I feel safe inside my own body)
marker_15.reasoning: The product addresses high-anxiety states: chemotherapy, radiation, diaper rash on a newborn. The emotional direction is removing panic and pain (Anxiety: 1/5 Panic Mode). The payoff is Sanctuary—feeling safe in one's body again, knowing the product won't cause a reaction (Self-Perception: 1/5 Sanctuary). Panic reduction + internal safety = Relief / Safety.
marker_15.evidence: Chemotherapy and radiation... Baby Safe... Diaper rash... Fragrance Free... Allergy tested

marker_16.slider_a_position_name: ▼ The Tool (I buy it only because it functions)
marker_16.slider_b_position_name: ▼ The Standard (What everyone uses; the default)
marker_16.reasoning: You don't buy this to look cool; you buy it because you have a problem and this is the tool to fix it. It is purely functional (Signal: 1/5 The Tool). As a top-seller (#2 Body Cream) with 19k+ reviews, it is the default standard for skin repair (Tribal: 1/5 The Standard). Functional tool + mass standard = The Pragmatist.
marker_16.evidence: Healing Ointment... #2 in Body Creams... 19,428 ratings... Multi Purpose Cream

marker_17.slider_a_position_name: ▼ Normalization ('I want to look like everyone else')
marker_17.reasoning: The social goal is Normalization—returning damaged skin to a normal state and using what the 'majority' (via dermatologist consensus) agrees is safe (Social Vector: 1/5 Normalization). It connects the user to the vast majority of patients and parents who trust this brand (Group Dynamic: 1/5 Majority). Normalization + Majority appeal = The Safe Choice.
marker_17.evidence: Recommended by 100,000 dermatologists... 19,428 global ratings... #105 in Beauty
